analysis.Summary: Defines the Vue Router route configuration for the "Notifications" section of the application, including layout, main page and preferences page routes.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a self-contained route object that can be imported into the root router to handle all `/notifications`-related paths and nested views.

Components.name: NotificationsLayout
Components.responsibility: Acts as the parent/layout wrapper for all notifications-related child routes.

Components.name: Notifications
Components.responsibility: Renders the main notifications page (list or overview of notifications).

Components.name: NotificationPreferences
Components.responsibility: Renders the user interface for configuring notification preferences.

analysis.Usage: Imported into the application's central router configuration (e.g. `router/index.js`) and merged into the `routes` array so that `/notifications` and its children become active routes.
Notes: The exported constant is misspelled as `nofitications` (typo) but used as the route definition for `/notifications`.
Both child routes have commented-out `requiresAuth` flagsâ€”authentication guards may be enabled in the future.
Each route defines a `meta.title` to drive dynamic document titles or breadcrumb labels.
